verses.verse: I will stand<WH5975> upon<WH5921> my watch,<WH4931> and set<WH3320> me upon<WH5921> the tower,<WH4692> and will watch<WH6822> to see<WH7200> what<WH4100> he will say<WH1696> unto me, and what<WH4100> I shall answer<WH7725> when<WH5921> I am reproved.<WH8433>

And the LORD<WH3068> answered<WH6030> me, and said,<WH559> Write<WH3789> the vision,<WH2377> and make it plain<WH874> upon<WH5921> tables,<WH3871> that<WH4616> he may run<WH7323> that readeth<WH7121> it.

For <WH3588> the vision<WH2377> is yet<WH5750> for an appointed time,<WH4150> but at the end<WH7093> it shall speak,<WH6315> and not<WH3808> lie:<WH3576> though<WH518> it tarry,<WH4102> wait<WH2442> for it; because<WH3588> it will surely come,<WH935> <WH935> it will not<WH3808> tarry.<WH309>
Behold, <WH2009> his soul<WH5315> which is lifted up<WH6075> is not upright<WH3474> <WH3808> in him: but the just<WH6662> shall live<WH2421> by his faith.<WH530>

Yea <WH637> also, because<WH3588> he transgresseth<WH898> by wine,<WH3196> he is a proud<WH3093> man,<WH1397> neither<WH3808> keepeth at home,<WH5115> who<WH834> enlargeth<WH7337> his desire<WH5315> as hell,<WH7585> and is as death,<WH4194> and cannot<WH3808> be satisfied,<WH7646> but gathereth<WH622> unto<WH413> him all<WH3605> nations,<WH1471> and heapeth<WH6908> unto<WH413> him all<WH3605> people: <WH5971>

Shall not<WH3808> all<WH3605> these<WH428> take up<WH5375> a parable<WH4912> against<WH5921> him, and a taunting<WH4426> proverb<WH2420> against him, and say,<WH559> Woe<WH1945> to him that increaseth<WH7235> that which is not<WH3808> his! how long?<WH5704> <WH4970> and to him that ladeth<WH3513> <WH5921> himself with thick clay!<WH5671>
Shall they not<WH3808> rise up<WH6965> suddenly<WH6621> that shall bite<WH5391> thee, and awake<WH3364> that shall vex<WH2111> thee, and thou shalt be<WH1961> for booties<WH4933> unto them?

Because <WH3588> thou<WH859> hast spoiled<WH7997> many<WH7227> nations,<WH1471> all<WH3605> the remnant<WH3499> of the people<WH5971> shall spoil<WH7997> thee; because of men's<WH120> blood,<WH4480> <WH1818> and for the violence<WH2555> of the land,<WH776> of the city,<WH7151> and of all<WH3605> that dwell<WH3427> therein.

Woe <WH1945> to him that coveteth<WH1214> an evil<WH7451> covetousness<WH1215> to his house,<WH1004> that he may set<WH7760> his nest<WH7064> on high,<WH4791> that he may be delivered<WH5337> from the power<WH4480> <WH3709> of evil!<WH7451>
Thou hast consulted<WH3289> shame<WH1322> to thy house<WH1004> by cutting off<WH7096> many<WH7227> people,<WH5971> and hast sinned<WH2398> against thy soul.<WH5315>
For <WH3588> the stone<WH68> shall cry out<WH2199> of the wall,<WH4480> <WH7023> and the beam<WH3714> out of the timber<WH4480> <WH6086> shall answer<WH6030> it.
Woe <WH1945> to him that buildeth<WH1129> a town<WH5892> with blood,<WH1818> and establisheth<WH3559> a city<WH7151> by iniquity!<WH5766>

Behold, <WH2009> is it not<WH3808> of<WH4480> <WH854> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> that the people<WH5971> shall labor<WH3021> in the very<WH1767> fire,<WH784> and the people<WH3816> shall weary<WH3286> themselves for very<WH1767> vanity?<WH7385>
For <WH3588> the earth<WH776> shall be filled<WH4390> <WH853> with the knowledge<WH1847> of the glory<WH3519> of the LORD,<WH3068> as the waters<WH4325> cover<WH3680> <WH5921> the sea.<WH3220>

Woe <WH1945> unto him that giveth his neighbor drink,<WH8248> <WH7453> that puttest<WH5596> thy bottle<WH2573> to him, and makest him drunken<WH7937> also,<WH637> that<WH4616> thou mayest look<WH5027> on<WH5921> their nakedness!<WH4589>

Thou art filled<WH7646> with shame<WH7036> for glory:<WH4480> <WH3519> drink<WH8354> thou<WH859> also,<WH1571> and let thy foreskin be uncovered:<WH6188> the cup<WH3563> of the LORD's<WH3068> right hand<WH3225> shall be turned<WH5437> unto<WH5921> thee, and shameful spewing<WH7022> shall be on<WH5921> thy glory.<WH3519>

For <WH3588> the violence<WH2555> of Lebanon<WH3844> shall cover<WH3680> thee, and the spoil<WH7701> of beasts,<WH929> which made them afraid,<WH2865> because of men's<WH120> blood,<WH4480> <WH1818> and for the violence<WH2555> of the land,<WH776> of the city,<WH7151> and of all<WH3605> that dwell<WH3427> therein.

What <WH4100> profiteth<WH3276> the graven image<WH6459> that<WH3588> the maker<WH3335> thereof hath graven<WH6458> it; the molten image,<WH4541> and a teacher<WH3384> of lies,<WH8267> that<WH3588> the maker<WH3335> of his work<WH3336> trusteth<WH982> therein,<WH5921> to make<WH6213> dumb<WH483> idols?<WH457>

Woe <WH1945> unto him that saith<WH559> to the wood,<WH6086> Awake;<WH6974> to the dumb<WH1748> stone,<WH68> Arise,<WH5782> it<WH1931> shall teach!<WH3384> Behold,<WH2009> it<WH1931> is laid over<WH8610> with gold<WH2091> and silver,<WH3701> and there is no<WH369> breath<WH7307> at all<WH3605> in the midst<WH7130> of it.
But the LORD<WH3068> is in his holy<WH6944> temple:<WH1964> let all<WH3605> the earth<WH776> keep silence<WH2013> before<WH4480> <WH6440> him.
